intro: Ardisia macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Ardisia macrocalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
